column4: hey guys. sorry for the newbie question, how can I add cronjob?
it's opens me a text editor, I need to add cron from shell script that i wrote
but it in /etc/cron.d/
same syntax as with crontab -e but you have to give a username after the time-part
i told you how to do without crontab -e
echo "* * * * * /home/misha/image.png" | crontab -e -u root not working too
no crontab for root - using an empty one
echo "* * * * * root command" > /etc/cron.d/mycron
not gived me an error, but it writes me "no crontab for root"
i told you three times how to do it
nothing worked from what you told
of your that is working
I tried every thing you sent me, nothing worked for me
echo "* * * * * root command" > /etc/cron.d/mycron    what is not working here?
when I do crontab -l it's shows me that the cron list is empty
crontab has nothing to do with /etc/cron.d/
crontab and /etc/cron.d/ are different things
sorry, didn't knew it
no problem
every file in /etc/cron.d/ is a cronjob
you know some command that i can run to see if everything is aright?
from the cron.d

i've did what you wrote to me with the command "* * * * * root php /home/misha/localhost/1.php", the file update my db and i've checked the file everything works when I run the command by myself, so i'm guessing that the cron.d not works
